casebody.data:
Russell BUCKLEW, Appellant
v.
Anne L. PRECYTHE, Director of the Department of Corrections, et al., Appellees No: 17-3052 United States Court of Appeals, Eighth Circuit. March 15, 2018 Raechel Jean Bimmerle, Robert N. Hochman, SIDLEY & AUSTIN, Chicago, IL, Cheryl Ann Pilate, MORGAN & PILATE, Kansas City, MO, for Plaintiff-Appellant Russell Bucklew, Pro Se. David J. Hansen, Stephen David Hawke, Michael Joseph Spillane, Assistant Attorneys General, Joshua Divine, ATTORNEY GENERAL'S OFFICE, Jefferson City, MO, for Defendants-Appellees.

ORDER

A judge in regular active service having requested a poll on whether to hear Bucklew's motion for stay of execution en banc, a poll was conducted. A majority of the judges in regular active service did not vote to hear the motion en banc.

Judge Kelly would hear the motion en banc. Judge Benton took no part in the consideration of this motion.
